maqras.text: And Abraham was certainly of his sect
when he came to his Lord with a defect less heart
When he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship
Do you intend to worship false gods besides God
So what is your guess about the Lord of the worlds?”
Then he looked (with a searching) look at the stars (probably because his people worshipped the stars too and)
then he said, “I am certainly sick.”
So his people turned their backs upon him and went away
Then he turned towards their (false) gods and said, “Why do you not eat
What is (wrong) with you that you do not speak?”
So he turned against them striking with his right hand
Then they came hastening towards him in confrontation
He said, “What! do you worship that which you (yourselves) carve
while God has created you and that which you do?”
They said, “Build a building (furnace) for him then put him into the fire.”
So they intended (to lay down) a plot against him but We made them the lower most
And he said, “I will certainly go away (from these people) towards my Lord, He will guide me
My Lord! grant me from among the righteous.”
So We conveyed to him the good news of a gentle son

Then when he reached (the age of) striving with him, he said, “O my son! I saw in my sleep (dream) that I am slaying you (as a sacrifice), then see, what do you consider (about it)?” He said. “O My father! do what you have been commanded (to do), if God wills, you will find me (to be) of the patient ones.”
Then, when they both submitted and he (Abraham) laid him down on his forehead, (at that moment)
We called out to him, “O Abraham
you have proved true the vision (by obeying in reality the order given to you through your dream so you need not sacrifice your son) thus do We reward the doers of good
this was nothing but a clear trail.”
And We ransomed him with a great slaughter (sacrifice of a sheep)
And We left on him (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others
Peace on Abraham
Thus do We reward the doers of good
He was certainly among Our believing servants
And We conveyed to him the good news of Isaac, a prophet, from among the righteous
And We showered Our blessings on him and on Isaac. And among their descendents are those who do good and (also) those who are clearly unjust to their own souls
And We bestowed Our favor on Moses and Aaron
and We saved both of them and their people from the great distress
and We helped them so they were the victors
And We gave them the book that made (things) clear
and We guided them both to the straight path
And We left on them both (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others
Peace on Moses and Aaron
Thus do We reward the doers of good
They both were among Our believing servants
And Elijah was certainly from among the messengers
When he said to his people, “Why do you not guard (against evil)
Why do you pray to Baal (the false sun god presumed by you) and forsake (God) the Best of proportioners
God is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”
But they denied him, so they certainly be presented (for punishment)
except the servants, exclusively of God
And We left on him, (the responsibility of conveying Our message) among others
Peace on Ilyaasiin
Thus do We reward the doers of good
He was certainly among Our believing servants
And Lot was certainly from among Our messengers
when We saved him and his followers all together
except an old woman (who was) among those who remained behind
then We destroyed the others
And you certainly pass by their (ruins) during the day
and during the night. Do you not then understand
And Jonah was certainly from among Our messengers
when he fled to the loaded ship
then drew lots but was among those who were slipped off (from the ship)
then the fish swallowed him and he was blameworthy
And had he not been among those who glorify (God)
he would have remained in its stomach till the day they are raised
